      Methods in sanavesa.net that return types with arguments of type ServerClient 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<ServerClient> Server.getClientList()

      Methods in sanavesa.net with parameters of type ServerClient 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T extends Server>
      void      		 NetworkSerializable.handleOnServer(T server, ServerClient sender)
      This method is invoked on the server side whenever this object is read by the server.
      <T extends Server>
      void      		 DisconnectClientPacket.handleOnServer(T server, ServerClient sender)
      This method is invoked whenever the client requests for server to disconnect.
      protected void Server.onClientConnected(ServerClient client)
      This method is triggered automatically when the client has successfully connected to the server.
      protected void Server.onClientDisconnected(ServerClient client)
      This method is triggered automatically when the client has disconnected from the server.
      (package private) <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.onReceivedData(T data, ServerClient sender)
      This method is triggered automatically when the server has received data from any client.
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.sendDataTo(T data, ServerClient recipient)
      Sends the specified data object to the specified client.
      Method parameters in sanavesa.net with type arguments of type ServerClient 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T extends NetworkSerializable>
      void      		 Server.sendDataToMatch(T data, java.util.function.Predicate<ServerClient> predicate)
      Sends the specified data object to the specified clients that are identified by the predicate.
      Constructors in sanavesa.net with parameters of type ServerClient 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerClientThread(ServerClient client)
      Creates a new thread for the client, and calls begins the networking communication loop.
